result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel E. Polar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must participate in anger management and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel E. Polar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joel E. Polar in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:43 AM. State - has complied with victim notification requirements with no request or statement submitted - here for a change of plea, scheduled for JT on 10/5/15, Poler willing to accept original offer by State of an amendment of count #1 to misd battery contrary to 940.19(1), 1 year probation, sentence withheld, court costs, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, 75 hours of community service, attend parenting class with active participation and successfully complete class. Kronenwetter and Polar agree. Court amends only count to battery contrary to 940.19(1), pleads NC to amended count. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentence - follow joint recommendation. Kronenwetter makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - provides court with certification of a completed parenting class that the defendant participated in. Polar makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 75 hours of community service, submit DNA sample and gives expunction collaquey, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Joel E. Polar in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:58 PM. State - not resolved at this time. Kronenwetter agrees - have received detailed offer from the State - very close to agreement - understands court process that the matter will now be set for JT. State - states offer - amend felony matter to misd battery contrary to 940.19(1) with 1 year probation and court costs, AODA, anger management, restitution if requested, absolute sobriety, no taverns or bars, employment/school, 75 hours of community service, no contact with AF except for as set by CSA, attend and complete parenting classes. Polar agrees. Court informs parties that the offer is no longer valid, continues bond, sets for JT, asks if the defendant understands Frye. Kroenenwetter's understanding from State is they had no problem with allowing defendant time to get him some information and still working on resolution. Court informs of 48 hour rule regarding assessing jury fees prior to JT.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel E. Polar
Current: P.O. Box 123, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 07-15-2015)
Prior: 5217 County Hwy. W, Crandon, WI 54520 United States
Must comply with all rules and supervision as set by Brown County Child Protecetive Services.

Defendant Joel E. Polar in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:35 PM. Kronenwetter asks Court for another FPT as he has just been retained. State has no objections. Court continues bond and sets for JT. Kronenwetter states that the defendant was generally confused by the offer. Court will set for another FPT, signs order for withdrawal of Rielly as counsel.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm. Recalled at 2:55 PM with same appearances. Kronenwetter wants to address conditions of bond. Kronenwetter - bond - asking to delete the no unsupervised contact with the child to "comply with all conditions as ordered by Brown County Chips case. State - no objections. Court - bond - modify to must comply with all rules and supervision as set by Brown County Child Protecetive Services.
Amended Motion for Withdrawal of Counsel - denied at this point

Defendant Joel E. Polar in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:57 PM. State - here for MH and FPT. Court now has motion, amended motion to withdraw as counsel. Rielly states he was appointed by SPD and the defendant related to Rielly that he was going to hire private counsel (Jay Kronenwetter). Court continues bond, set for another FPT. Court not granting motion at this time and if the defendant has retained private counsel, Rielly can appear telephonically.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joel E. Polar in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:06 p.m. State - has had discussion and has guaranteed no felony disposition if case finishes quickly, have filed information (mirrors) with anticipation that PH will be waived. All parties agree. Court goes over preliminary hearing waiver form with defendant and finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Rielly - proceed to ARGN, has Information filed today and waives further reading, enters guilty on only count. Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joel E. Polar in court with attorney Michael Rielly. Called 1:40 pm. District attorney is not available. Court  advises of complaint penalties/rights and right to attorney. Rielly asks for PH and will waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Bond continued. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel E. Polar
Current: 5217 County Hwy. W, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2015)
Prior: 2799 State Highway 55, Crandon, WI 54520
No unsupervised contact with the child.

Defendant Joel E. Polar in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:10 AM. Polar has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Polar understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, needs a little more time to hire an attorney, given court appointed paperwork in Court. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - $2000.00 signature and comply with any previous orders of the Department of Social Services. Court - bond - $2000.00 signature bond - no unsupervised contact with the child.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:45 am. The defendant refused to take the court appointed attorney paperwork offered by the Clerk.
